column4: Hi. I'm trying to install vmplayer from automatix. I'm stuck at the user end agreement : at the end of it there's <OK> but I can't click it to have the installation resume.
since it's right there in the standard repositories ready to be installed, why in the world would you use automatix to get it?
is it a text-mode dialog or a GNOME dialog or a KDE dialog that shows the agreement?
Tab followed by Enter, or just Enter, will do the trick in some cases, but not in all. Adept for instance is known to have a problem with debconf dialogs.
